title: User-Centric Data Access Control – Granular Permission Settings for Caregivers
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to set granular permission levels for accessing patient health data so that I can ensure privacy while effectively monitoring and coordinating care for my rural patients.

title: Intuitive User Interface Design – Simplified Navigation for Caregivers
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want an intuitive interface to easily access patient health data and manage care tasks without complicated setup, so that I can efficiently monitor my patients and respond promptly to their needs.

title: Real-Time Health Data Synchronization for Remote Monitoring
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to receive real-time updates from health monitoring devices so that I can track my patients' vital signs and health metrics efficiently, allowing for timely interventions and informed care strategies.

title: Comprehensive User Training Resources – Interactive Video Tutorials for Independent Learning
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to access interactive video tutorials independently so that I can explore the system features at my own pace and enhance my ability to monitor and care for my patients effectively.

title: Health Alert Notifications
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to receive push notifications for health alerts such as anomalies in patient vitals so that I can promptly respond to potential issues and ensure my patients' well-being.

title: Cross-Platform Integration for Health Monitoring
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want ALFRED to integrate with third-party health applications so that I can track patient health data from various devices and platforms, enabling me to monitor their well-being more effectively and efficiently.

title: Adaptive Learning and Support
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want the ALFRED system to adapt to my learning style and preferences so that I can explore features at my own pace and improve my efficiency in monitoring patient health remotely.
